intro: Pinda concanensis, commonly known as the Konkan pinda, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in dense undergrowth. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Pinda concanensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small fauna.
